description.value:
Biome: Swamps, Underdark & Caves

The fungus begins life as a tiny spore that floats until inhaled and lodges in the moist tissue of the lungs. The spore grows, causing irritation, pain, and eventually death once the fungus reaches a sizable mass. After the host dies, the fungus rapidly expands and pushes a hollow tendril out of the corpse. At the exposed end the tendril forms a thin membrane inflated by gases from the rotting body. When the membrane ruptures and disperses spores, every breathing creature within 40 feet must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or inhale spores. If they fail, each hour thereafter the creature must make a Constitution save with a cumulative -1 penalty; each failed hour inflicts cumulative piercing damage ([[/roll 1d6]] the first hour, 2d6 the second, [[/roll 3d6]] the third, etc.) as the fungus spreads through organs. A single successful save stops the process and renders the fungus inert. If the fungus catches fire, the spore sac may explode: everyone within 20 feet must make a DC 15 Dexterity save or suffer [[/roll 3d6]] fire damage (half on a success); the blast incinerates all spores.

system.source: Broderick's Compendium: Plants and Fungi Across the Realm (version 2.0)
